title: Mrs Hinch says trolling 'absolutely kills' her after receiving vile abuse about baby son
text:

Mrs Hinch has outed another social media troll as they called her baby son the "ugliest thing".

The cleaning guru, 29, shared that she is going to keep exposing these people and revealed "it absolutely kills me" when people talk about her three-month-old son Ronnie.

In her post she said: "I hope your day has started better than mine. I'm going to keep exposing these kinds of awful people because I think it is so wrong that there are no consequences for internet trolling and bullying.

"I'm learning every day to become stronger towards it, even though people talking about my son absolutely kills me, but next time you message someone, they might be having the worst day and be unable to cope with this sort of thing.

(Image: instagram)

"And why should they have to! So I'm standing up to it! And I will keep doing so until it stops!"

It comes after her son Ronnie was trolled in September which left her in floods of tears.

(Image: instagram)

(Image: instagram)

Sophie had a difficult pregnancy and had to be rushed to hospital in April after falling sick.

Her unborn son had to be monitored as she was kept in overnight to have everything checked over.

Mrs Hinch cancelled her upcoming book tour to focus on her baby, apologising to fans for the inconvenience.

She said: "I am so sorry to let you all down. This has been the hardest decision for me to make, and this is the hardest message I've ever had to type and I can't deny how scared I'm feeling inside right now.

Luckily, further tests found the baby's heartbeat was fine and Sophie was discharged from hospital.
description: Sophie Hinch was left shaken up by social media trolls as they attack baby Ronnie with disgusting comments again
